front.title: Obtaining and Using Globally Routable User Agent (UA) URIs (GRUU) in the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)

abstract.t: Several applications of the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) requirea user agent (UA) to construct and distribute a URI which can be usedby anyone on the Internet to route a call to that specific UAinstance. A URI which routes to a specific UA instance is called aGlobally Routable UA URI (GRUU). This document describes an extensionto SIP for obtaining a GRUU from a server, and for communicating aGRUU to a peer within a dialog.
